summary: This is an email from an anonymous sender to the FBI New York field office, offering to provide information and photos related to the Epstein case. The sender identifies as a victim, expresses emotional distress, and indicates they have more information to share.

persons.name: Anonymous Sender
persons.context: The individual sending an email to the FBI, offering photos and information, expressing personal burden and identifying with other victims.

events.title: Email to FBI Offering Information
events.description: An anonymous individual sends an email to the FBI's New York field office, offering to provide photos and information related to the Epstein case, describing it as a burden and expressing hope for justice.

keyFacts: An anonymous individual contacted the FBI New York field office via email on March 4, 2021, offering to provide photos and information.
The sender identifies with other victims, expresses emotional distress, and describes sharing the information as 'one of the hardest things' they've ever done.
The email subject line 'No More Pics' and reference to 'photos' suggest the sender possesses visual evidence.
The sender indicates there is more information beyond what was initially provided and invites further contact.
The communication highlights ongoing efforts by victims or witnesses to come forward with evidence years after Epstein's death.
